conclusion: The process from B to C is an isobaric expansion with constant pressure.
Pressure remains constant at p = 2 x 10^5 Pa, volume increases from V_B = 2 x 10^-3 m^3 to V_C = 3 x 10^-3 m^3.
For an isobaric process, work done by the gas is given by W = p ΔV.
Calculate change in volume ΔV = V_C - V_B = 1 x 10^-3 m^3.
Substitute values into work formula: W = p ΔV = (2 x 10^5) x (1 x 10^-3).
The work done externally by the gas from state B to state C is 200 J.
